background.story: A hero who saved countless lives from the Demons, and the current commander of the Holy Knights of the Church of Lua. This brave and seasoned knight has been hunting down Demons all across Orvelia since his younger days. He is also the headmaster of the orphanage where Kasel, Frey, and Clause grew up. He trained countless warriors in Orvelia and is considered their spiritual leader. He is preparing to step down from the position due to his age, but his age-defying strength has always led to the denial of his retirement request.

itemIntroductions.weapon: When the Holy Sword Aea was bestowed upon Kyle, it appeared in the Temple of Lua located north of the King's Plains. When Kyle removed the sword from the altar, it released a powerful wave of light that turned the entire vicinity into a sacred ground. Everything contained within the Temple was turned into holy relics. Teoria, the central pillar of the Temple, absorbed the greatest amount of holy energy of them all.
treasures: A ceremonial stole bestowed upon the Grand Master of the Holy Knights. Ricardo made it into an insignia and put it on his armor to boost the morale of his comrades on the battlefield. When the stole waves as he swings Theoria at evil creatures, courage fills the hearts of his allies who see it.

Shield of the arbiter of Lua's Holy Knights. Artifact given to those who've earned the title of Arbiter from the Lua's Holy Knights. An artifact imbued with Goddess Lua's blessing, it protects those under the benevolence of the god, and punishes enemies without mercy.

The seal that Ricardo used for the pledge of the Holy Warrior. When first appointed as a Holy Warrior, knights leave their names on the certificate of oath with their seals. Ricardo made his seal with his affection for the Church of Lua. He still carries it now, after all this time.

The symbol of Ricardo Orphanage, which has a small cross at the center of a bigger one. It was made when the orphanage was built, in the hope that Ricardo's prayers could include the unspoken wishes of the youngest children who did not know any words. Great Priestess Iris also blessed it in the name of Lua, and it is said that it keeps diseases away from children while they grow up.
